alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 7:08PM MDT until August 07 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL FREMONT COUNTY... At 708 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain have moved east of the warned area. Doppler radar estimates between 1 and 2 inches of rain over the past hour, with flash flooding ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Texas Creek. This includes the following streams and drainages... Squaw Creek, Fear Creek, Monument Creek, South Newlin Creek, Copper Gulch, Middle Tallahassee Creek, Quagmire Creek, Carrol Creek, Arkansas River, Chandler Creek, Grape Creek, Texas Creek, Tallahassee Creek, Oak Creek and Sandy Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
